Geology_Comment: Brecciated andesite, greenish color with Qtz (clear) veinlets 1-10 mm wide, Hm   <   Gt fractures + calcite,
Brecciated andesite, pale green, fault zone; crushed rock 15-20 cm wide with Bx relicts;
Andesite breccia, greenish rock, no competent (weak) moderately faulted 50°; clay + sericite + chlorite + calcite in gouge; ox decrease ox along erratic fractures with Gt  >  Hem.
Andesite breccia; Continuation of fracture/faulting zone (50°); increase FeOx strings on fault/fracturing Hm  >  Gt.
Metavolcanics (gray to green) coarse to flow texture with interbedded fine-grained interval .
Metavolcanic, gray-orange, porphyritic; Calcite + Hem + Gt veinlets 1-2 mm hm (stain no hydrothermal); disseminated, euhedral PyOx. Fault upper contact 60°.
White Qtz vein PyOx + hm + Kln (kaolinite) +MnOx; massive texture with also cracked zones. Voids filled with FeOx (Hm) + MnOx.
Strong fault zone; weak Qtz (m) veinlets with Py Ox + hm, low sericite; gouge at bottom rich in ser + chl.
Metavolcanic, green, porphyritic-dotted texture (PyOx) Hm + calcite 1-3 mm wide, 32.55-33.35 m Qtz vein + Py Ox.
Metandesite, orange, porphyritic; Agglomeratic texture; weakly foliated metavolcanics, S1= 60° faults 70°-60° and Qtz veinlets(1-5 mm) strong calcite associated with calcareous clay.
Fault-Vein (white Qtz + PyOx+ Hm + Calcite) Ox 1% (fine grained); Pale orange color.
Metandesite, orange-green; Sericite-Ch (1-2) weak;  green (alteration) color;  volcanoclastic texture (in rock fragments) with weak foliation S1 (40°)
Metandesite (tuff?) Calcite  Qtz + Py veinlets (1-2 mm wide) Qtz + Hm + PyOx + calcite veinlets (50-60°) with 0.5-2 cm wide. Faulted at the top (40°)
Porphyritic to Agglomeratic, medium grained; weak foliation, with some faults with clay-gouge (FeOx) erratic calcite + PyOx veinlets; scarce narrow Qtz+Py veinlets 1-3 mm wide.
Fractured volcanic rock (S1=35°); weak to moderately calcareous; disseminated PyOx (1-2 %)  associated with fractured zones.
Green coarse foliated Metavolcanic (?) Change in texture and color; decrease oxidation, as patchy-spotty PyOx (Hm); erratic Qtz veinlets.

Fault zone in Metavolcanic rocks; coarse grained with crushed-brecciated intervals, oxidized-mixed-primary sulfides interval, at bottom start fresh Py  (Primary sulfide). Fractures filled with hm 40°. Qtz veinlets with 50°.
Decrease faulting-foliated intervals: erratic milky Qtz  veinlets with low FeOx (hm) on walls of veinlets; clay   >   prop  >   ser alteration; disseminated, fine-grained pyrite along fractures 50°.
Foliated metavolcanic, green color; scarce milky Qtz veinlets, 2 cm wide with Hm (FeOx) halo (narrow).
Bleached Metavolcanic; coarse texture with faulting narrow faults (60°;  20 cm wide). Fractures & foliation with angles ranging between 15 & 25°.
Green to pale green foliated, weakly leached; coarse grained; calcite veinlets 2-10 mm.
Metavolcanic tuff, fine grained grey color; erratic fault 60° with drag folding; decrease fresh disseminated Py,  >  1%, 2 cm wide (erratic)
Pale green Metavolcanic coarse grained with calcite veinlets, fault zone.

Fine grained andesite with Qtz+ calcite + PyOx 50°   >   1 cm wide; disseminated calcite and as erratic veinlets   <   2-3 mm; PyOx associated to fractures faulting and Qtz + calcite veinlets FeOx halo.
Metavolcanic, coarse grained, with Qtz + calcite + PyOx veinlets 1-2.5 cm wide associated to top of faulting (upper contact 45°, lower 30°)
Metarhyolite, coarse grained, foliated; foliation varies 15-30°. 44.05-46.3 Fault zone (29°) from 44.05 to 47.85 m.
Metarhyolite, gray-green, foliated; foliation varies 15-30°. 44.05-46.3 Fault zone (47.85°) from 52.00 to 56.25.
Metarhyolite, gray; erratic-patchy silicification, crushed interval, with strong orange color, increase Qtz + PyOx veinlets 42° 1-15 cm wide average.
Metarhyolite, orange to gray, weekly altered; foliation 50°; disseminate calcite and veinlets 1-2 mm + FeOx; moderated fractures.

Fault zone. Weak to moderate calcite disseminated associated with Qtz+ PyO + Py fresh + calcite & erratic Qtz + Py + Galena (traces) veinlets with calcite(thickness   >   10 cm) 40° associate with fault, mixed zone (Sulfides +  Oxides); disseminated  Py 1-2%.

Metarhyolite, green orange, coarse grained; Moderate to strong fracturing; foliation 45-50°, mixed zone with fresh-fine Py  2-3%, disseminated; hm along fractures/faulting, 79.50 m, Qtz galena veinlets 1 cm,  20°; fault associate strong clay and gouge.

Metavolcanic. Coarse grained rock with moderate fracturing and intercalated faults; foliation 70°, Fault zone from 88.10 to 93.75; this interval increase 3% disseminated Py  + chlorite, erratic Qtz veinlets; angles from faulting: top 70° bottom 75°.

Metavolcanic; strong foliated; coarse grained rock, drags folds(?) in faulting with increase in chloritic + sericite. S1 varies from 40°-60°; scarce & erratic Qtz veinlets. FeOx just in fractures and Goe  >  Hm. 130.95-132.25 QZ + calcite close to bottom interval.
Andesitic dike (?) Fine grained. Contact 50°.
Metavolcanic; strong foliated; coarse grained rock,
Metarhyolite, gray to pale orange; weak foliated with minor fracturing; increase oxidation and Qtz + calcite veinlets.
Metarhyolite; pale orange; disseminated PyOx 2%  and fine-coarse Qtz + calcite 30-25° 1-5 mm wide FeOx (Hm  >  goethite) in fractures and over printing in interval.

Metarhyolite, pale-green-weak orange; 0.1 fresh Py , 1-2 % PyOx, disseminated, 1-2% Qtz + calcite veinlets; weak foliation, 60°; faulting 60°; erratic Qtz + calcite + galena (traces) 2 mm to 30 mm wide (160.70-161.25).
Metarhyolite, dark green; Coarse porphyritic texture, foliated; moderate-strong fracturing 45°-50°, filled with Hm, Qtz; veinlets increase to moderate.

Metavolcanic (?), green; increase propylitic alteration, & decrease oxidation along fractures. Fractured zone (weak-moderate) decrease FeOx oxidation to Gt  >  hm into fractures, Qtz + calcite + Py decrease to erratic; low RQD due intense broken zone.
Metarhyolite, pale green. weak foliation 50°, weak fracturing  (55-60°) varies filled with Chl Gt+ hm (2-15 cm) weak to traces fresh Py. Good RQD and core recovery.
Metarhyolite, green. Moderately fractured; Oxidized (weak-mod) FeOx, weak-mod specularite diss and filling fractures; Oxidation halos. Look like Kln-AH. (Potassic). Specularite.
Fault zone, Metavolcanic (Jar-Gt >  Hem).
Metavolcanic/Metarhyolite(?), grey; fresh rock zone, oxidized materials. Qtz+Hem veinlets.   <  1cm wide with 45°-65°; Fractures 60°, filled with FeOx; erratic specularite along fractures (12.65 m).
Strong Fault zone. Broken rock (R2), moderate FeOx + MnOx.
Strongly crushed; clay rich interval; breccia cemented with clays; erratic Qtz veinlets with FeOx up to 4 mm thick in average but some are 2.4 cm thick.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite) gray; porphyritic texture, weakly foliated; Qtz + FeOx + Calcite as erratic veinlets. 50°-60°  Qtz veinlets, 5-20 mm in thickness.
Strongly crushed rock interval, angular fragments. 43.25-49.10 Metavolcanic (rhyolite). 49.10-51.10 (Meta andesite).
Metandesite, gray to orange fine-medium grained; erratic calcite veinlets; 1-15 mm thick; disseminated PyOx , fractures filled with FeOx, weak S1=60°. Lower contact by fault (25°).
Shear zone; Strong foliation; Deformed Calcite veinlets in foliation by shearing. Metavolcanic (rhyolite); chlorite increase.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite) pale orange; low sheering-foliated; Qtz + FeOx + MnOx + ArK? + Calcite veinlets. 77.50-77.70m Qtz+FeOx + Calcite veinlets.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), gray-pale orange; decrease FeOx; weak silicification, erratic Qtz + Calcite veinlets (1-5 mm wide).
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), gray, foliated (S1=45°-60°); Deformed calcite veinlets; low (Tz) PyOx (Tz) disseminated; fresh rock, low argillic-propylitization alterations.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite); weak faulted zone (50°); Calcite veinlets & disseminated; argillized  and weakly faulting rock & crushed-sheared intervals.
Fault zone, moderate-strong. Erratic calcite veinlets.
Qtz vein, brecciated texture interval, orange red color interval.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), gray color; lower faulted contact (60°), brecciated/autobrecciated texture; Erratic calcite veinlets.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), green, porphyritic; Calcite veinlets ; fractures 65°-70°. Low fractured interval.

Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), green, brecciated and/or strongly deformed (sheered); Deformed calcite along foliation plane & cracks, 1-10 mm wide. Foliation 30°-40°. Shear zone Z folding. Andesitic fine grained  dykes interbedded  140.45-140.85 (green color) emplaced by faulting.
Fault zone; Qtz + Calcite + MnOx Veinlets 30-40 cm thick, 45° & angle; (PyOx less than 1 percent).
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite); Porphyritic; erratic calcite veinlets; weak to moderate fracturing (some as foliation).
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), brecciated; extension cracks filled with calcite; bottom plane 45° (fault?).
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), porphyritic; Calcite veinlets, foliated 45°, extension and crack filled with calcite.
Fault zone. Crushed material, moderate fracturing, only goethite, hematite decrease.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), green; Low-moderate fracturing, 50°.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite); Moderate calcite veinlets; Cracks by extension; 193.8-194.25m, fault 60°.

Metarhyolite, pale gray; Faulted lower contact 60°; Calcite fractures, low to erratic Qtz veinlets; White-milky Qtz fragment. Moderate fracturing,  45°-60°. At 5.80 m depth, fracture with Cu stains (chrysocolla).
Metarhyolite, pale gray; Jarosite rich interval; increase silicification, porphyritic texture.
Fault zone; Fresh-fine disseminated pyrite. Py + Qtz veinlets 2.4 mm thick. Mixed zone (oxide + sulfides); from 20.15 to 20.65, gouge zone (fault).

Rhyolite (metavolcanic) pale gray-white, porphyritic; Moderate Qtz+Chl+Ser stockwork (1-2mm thick). Scarce calcite, fine-fresh pyrite, disseminated. Moderate fracturing (filled with calcite+chlorite). Fault zone from 30.15 to 31.15, with narrow andesitic dike, with abundant clays (crushed-broken rock).
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), gray, compact rock, weak fracturemet & weal stockwork; Moderate calcite + Qtz veinlets (1-2mm) chlorite rich interval.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), gray; scarce stockwork Qtz + Calcite, erratic fresh Pyrite; calcite increase in open fractures/stockwork.

Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), pale green; epidote along fractures + Kaolinite; Increase Qtz + Calcite stockwork; Several narrow faults less than 30 cm in thickness; fractures 30°-55°; fresh-disseminated pyrite.
Porphyry dyke, not stockwork. Fresh rock. Intrusive contact 45°; foliation/flow 50°.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), pale gray; Increase stockwork, 76.90-78.60m. Pyrite (fresh) disseminated and clusters/veinlets. Dissolution voids at the bottom of the interval.
Fracture/fault zone 45°. Increase Hem and silicification, argillic (Kln) in fault planes. Black mineral less than 1 percent (turmaline?)
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), gray, porphyritic; milky Qtz veinlets (60°), from 83.0-84.95m fault zone 35° with Qtz veinlets, 1-15mm thick, 60°.
Fault zone; Crushed material rock. Clay (Kln)-rich and broken rock.
Metavolcanic (Rhyolite), white-pale green; disseminated pyrite (less than 0.1%) Py+Qtz clear gray Qtz (0.5%). Patchy epidote, Kln + sulfides along fractures. Erratic disseminated turmaline.
Fault zone; Pale green, 45° fault plane.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), beige color. Low recovery & RQD; fractured zone with MnOx along fractures   >  Goethite; fractures 50° QZ veinlets fragments.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), grey-pale green with weak foliation , Kln (clay in fault zone narrow   >  5 cm wide) PyOx fine and disseminated, FeOx halos wall to fragments 40-45°.
Andesitic dike. Foliated (flow) 40°, fine grained, scarce calcite veinlets (1-2 mm), 20.4-21.3 fault 50°.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), grey with porphyritic texture; fractured interval, MnOx + FeOx along fractures; Qtz veinlets 24.35-25.65 (milky Qtz)
Metarhyolite, orange-black with abundant MnOx along fractures; scarce Qtz veinlets (?).
Fault/Vein; Bx Qtz cemented by FeOx (H  >  G), Jarosite in crushed material.
Andesitic dike, black-green, fine grained; fractures (25°) with MnOx  >  Goe, PyOx erratic Qtz + PyOx 2-4 mm wide (erratic) + calcite.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite);  porphyritic texture poorly foliated with MnOx along fractures; Hm disseminated and along fractures (45-50°).
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite);  Qtz + H+ G +MnOx veinlets( 45°); 2-4 mm with oxidation halo.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite); Porphyritic (feldspar) texture (Pl 4mm) faulting/fractured zone broken interval.
MnOx increase, weak fractures 40 y 50°.
Strong orange color due hematite; weak Qtz veinlets 2 m wide (50°); Hanging wall of vein  zone. Lower contact (fault) 40°.
Fault zone. Grey orange. Lower contact 35°. Filled with milky QZ  + Hm crushed material; clay rich.

Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), grey, porphyritic; Increase MnOx decrease FeOx (PyOx) to couple of intervals, Qtz eye rock (abundant), from 74.25-90.95 MnOx (?) increase; weak to moderate fracturing 50° same angle than foliation.
Fault zone (60°); MnOx (?) in some crushed material; crushed rock clay-rich, low (weak) FeOx; metavolcanic (RHYO) fragments.

Metavolcanic pale orange; weak rock, strong altered to clay, erratic milky Qtz-veinlet 2-4 mm wide; groundmass altered to clay and FeOx (H); from 103.50 to103.85 fault, weak fracturing fractures 35-50°. Qtz veinlets (H) with op to 2 cm (60°).
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite); moderate-strong FeOx (H  >  J); no MnOx; erratic Qtz veinlets; fractures 45° filled with Hm.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite); strong-pervasive FeOx host rock and fractures weak-moderate Qtz veinlets + Hm Qtz veinlets (5-10 mm wide) 60-70°; weak argillic alteration, relicts of silicification.
Leached rock with increase of argillic alteration with autobrecciated zone, 10 cm wide, ( 45-50°).
Compact interval, low (weak) fractured (40)°, filled with clay + Hm +MnOx; semi-fresh rock interval with scarce 2 mm Qtz veinlets.
Moderate Qtz veinlets 2 cm wide, strong oxidation. Faulted lower contact (60°)
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), grey. Weak argillization, porphyritic weak fracturing 60°. Faulted lower contact (45°)
Fault zone; increase argillic alteration in crushed/broken rock; FeOx mainly on fractures/fault planes, scarce Qtz veinlets (thin).
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), grey. Fractured zone, FeOx, MnOx. strong MnOx at bottom of interval. Lower faulted contact (35°)
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), grey; weakly foliated 50°; scarce FeOx; no argillic.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), erratic Qtz veinlet 2mm, moderate fracturing increase FeOx/Argilization. Upper (40°) and Lower (25°) faulted contacts.
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), gray-orange; patchy PyOx close to fractures and veinlets as halo; increase MnOx in fractures; Qtz + PyOx + Hm veinlets 45° 2-4 mm wide (weak). Lower faulted contact (45°)
Metavolcanic (metarhyolite), porphyritic; compact rock (good recovery/RQD); low fracturing 40-50°; Qtz veinlets 30-50°.  From 157.20 to 162.05 Qtz-veinlets some veinlets have Qtz+ Py + late calcite.
